net.beaconcontroller.core

Interface IBeaconProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Controller, MockBeaconProvider

    public interface IBeaconProvider
    The interface exposed by the core bundle that allows you to interact with connected switches.
    Author:
    David Erickson (daviderickson@cs.stanford.edu)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addOFInitializerListener(IOFInitializerListener listener)
      Adds an initializer listener that will be used for each newly connecting switch.
      void addOFMessageListener(OFType type, IOFMessageListener listener) 
      void addOFSwitchListener(IOFSwitchListener listener)
      Add a switch listener
      List<IOFInitializerListener> getInitializers()
      Return a non-modifiable list of all registered initializers
      Map<OFType,List<IOFMessageListener>> getListeners()
      Return a non-modifiable list of all current listeners
      InetAddress getListeningIPAddress()
      Returns an object containing the IP address that Beacon is listening on for switch connections.
      int getListeningPort()
      Returns an object containing the port that Beacon is listening on for switch connections.
      Map<Long,IOFSwitch> getSwitches()
      Returns a read-only map of all OpenFlow switches in the ACTIVE state
      void initializerComplete(IOFSwitch sw, IOFInitializerListener listener)
      Once an initializer has initialized a switch it calls this method which removes the initializer for the specified switch, sending OFMessages to the next listener in sequence, or making the switch active if the sequence for the specified switch becomes empty.
      void removeOFInitializerListener(IOFInitializerListener listener)
      Removes an initializer listener from the list that is used for each switch
      void removeOFMessageListener(OFType type, IOFMessageListener listener) 
      void removeOFSwitchListener(IOFSwitchListener listener)
      Remove a switch listener
